thread.title: DU edges CC 2-1, despite freshman goalie's heroics
thread.title_full: DU edges CC 2-1, despite freshman goalie's heroics

author: Mike Chambers
title: DU edges CC 2-1, despite freshman goalie's heroics
text:
Harrop: Is Donald Trump really running things? 
Colorado College goalie Alex Leclerc wasn’t exactly fresh off a 45-save shutout win over North Dakota, given that the Tigers were idle last weekend, but let’s just say the 5-foot-10 goalie was outstanding for a second consecutive game against a perennial national power Friday night. 
In a sellout atmosphere at Magness Arena, the little goalie with extreme skill and quickness kept the Tigers afloat against the No. 2-ranked Denver Pioneers, who dominated puck possession for most of the game. In the end, CC couldn’t support Leclerc with enough offense and the Pioneers emerged with a 2-1 victory — their 11th straight over the Tigers. 
Denver outshot its Front Range rival 39-15 and Leclerc finished with 37 saves in the opener of the two-game, home-and-home Gold Pan series, which moves to the Broadmoor World Arena on Saturday at 6 p.m. Senior defenseman and team captain Will Butcher had two assists for DU. 
Denver took a 1-0 lead 1:37 into the game and led 2-0 at 5:34 of the second period. Defenseman Adam Plant beat Leclerc with a long shot through traffic on his first shift of the game and forward Jarid Lukosevicius struck on the power play early in the second. Related Articles
